```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(RSQLite)
library(data.table)
library(topicmodels)
library(tidyverse)
library(tidytext)

# Load Data
input_text <- data.table(read.csv("tweets.csv"))
```

## Data Preparations

We have scraped from Python using the tweeper library any tweets that contains "North Korea".  For LDA analysis  


```{r cars}

# Converting tweets Term Document Matrix 
TD_matrix <- input_text	%>%
  select(tweet) %>%
  as.matrix() %>%
  tm::VectorSource() %>%
  tm::Corpus() %>%
  tm::tm_map(tm::removeWords, tm::stopwords("english")) %>%
  tm::tm_map(tm::removeWords, c("amp", "The", "will", 'You','just', 'https')) %>%
  tm::TermDocumentMatrix() %>%
  # tm::removeSparseTerms(sparse = 0.9995) %>%
  as.matrix()

```
